meanings.definition: Words or expressions that are no longer in common use.
meanings.sent1: In her writing, the author included several archaisms to give a historical feel to the story.
meanings.sent2: The professor explained that understanding archaisms is important for interpreting old texts.
meanings.sent3: The children found the archaisms in the play amusing, as they had never heard such words before.
meanings.sent4: The archaisms sprinkled throughout the poem added a touch of nostalgia to the verses.
meanings.sent5: The archaisms in the ancient manuscript made it challenging to translate accurately.

meanings.definition: The use of outdated language or style.
meanings.sent1: The novel's archaisms made it difficult for modern readers to fully grasp the meaning.
meanings.sent2: The playwright's deliberate use of archaisms added a sense of authenticity to the historical drama.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's exaggerated archaisms in his routine had the audience in stitches.
meanings.sent4: Her speech was filled with archaisms that transported the listeners back in time.
meanings.sent5: The archaisms in the document were a clear indication of its age and origin.

meanings.definition: A word or phrase that is old-fashioned or obsolete.
meanings.sent1: The dictionary included a section on archaisms to help readers understand older texts.
meanings.sent2: The linguist specialized in identifying archaisms in ancient manuscripts.
meanings.sent3: The teacher asked the students to identify any archaisms they came across in the classic novel.
meanings.sent4: The poet's use of archaisms gave his work a timeless quality.
meanings.sent5: The archaisms in the speech sounded strange to the younger audience members.
